metadata.title: CVE-2021-47055 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: mtd:require write permissions for locking and badblock ioctls MEMLOCK,MEMUNLOCK and OTPLOCK modify protection bits. Thus require writepermission. Depending on the hardware MEMLOCK might even be write-once,e.g. for SPI-NOR flashes with their WP# tied to GND. OTPLOCK is alwayswrite-once. MEMSETBADBLOCK modifies the bad block table.

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
